channel.title: Potential wars covered in call of Duty games
channel.description:
I have recently started to enjoy the series... Or should I say Call of duty 2 and 5. It has occured to me that call of duty does its best(meaning most interesting story and content wise) when it is bringing new ways of looking at previous conflicts in history. When I looked at information about a Cod ww1 there were very mixed emotions from "boring" to "interesting". While I personally find that the amazing scripted sequences and bigger that life action will bring out a heavy handed anti war message and speak out against the cruelty of chemical warfare and warfare itself, I wanted to know what you the people thought. :fffuuu: come what may.
Also if you wish to add any other war ideas for the popular franchise please do. (with an explanation of some sort)

It was the civil war.

Great dialogue.

item.title: Potential wars covered in call of Duty games
item.dc:creator: BrAndi
item.description:
Norther Ireland Conflict, or Civils wars in general would be awesome. I tire of this "You are an elite military professional and win the day … " BLAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA.

I want a game where you kidnapp, rob banks, assassinate, with world-bankers, Rockefellers, companies and so on.

Read full topic

item.title: Potential wars covered in call of Duty games
item.dc:creator: THRRRPT
item.description:
Our chief weapon is surprise! Surprise and fear…Fear and surprise!
Our TWO weapons are fear and surprise and a ruthless efficiency…
THREE weapons! Fear, surprise, a ruthless efficiency and an almost fanatical devotion to the pope!
FOUR weapons! No…
Amongst our weapons are…Amongst our WEAPONRY are such elements as fear surprise - I’ll come in again…

item.title: Potential wars covered in call of Duty games
item.dc:creator: DethklokSoldier
item.description:
Maxey:

They need to make a game about the Spanish inquisition, where you burn heretics alive and then there’s this complete and very detailed torture simulator.

Then Michael Palin sucks your dick if you play it for more than 5 hours in a row.

“I wasn’t expecting some kind of Spanish Inquisition!”
Door breaks down
“NOBODY EXPECTS THE SPANISH INQUISITION!”

If nobody gets the reference, then I feel very sorry for you.

Read full topic

item.title: Potential wars covered in call of Duty games
item.dc:creator: mankyman6
item.description:
I wouldn’t mind a WWI video game done by a professional company. Hell, this seems like the perfect thing Call of Duty could do right, since CoD tends to try and over-excite these wars.

They could actually make WWI seem interesting. I can already imagine an action packed trench charge with German machine guns pounding and bringing down Entente soldiers. Now they just can’t include the inevitable retreat that follows these charges or else a giant phallus of rage will penetrate their contemptuous posteriors.

Read full topic
